alert.note: Alert for Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 5:38PM EDT until July 26 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Surry. In southwest Virginia, Carroll and Patrick. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 536 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported flooding in the Mt Airy area around Holly Springs Road. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Mt. Airy is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Archies Creek, Big Creek, Beaverdam Creek and Ararat River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Flat Rock... Cana... Ararat... Bottom... Toast... White Plains... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
